Articles.Content:
Hello everyone,

I'm new here. I have been searching for a space forum for million ages and finally I have found one. I want to thank the admins already.

Let me introduce myself. I'm Lisa and I have been collecting space information since I was a child (approximately 9 years old). I also wanted to touch the moon at age 5. And I already knew much about the Sun at age 8. 

Oh yeah a show off line: I met 4 ESA astronauts on the same day this year and received signed pictures.

Hello, Sparkle! Welcome to the Forums!

Are space forums really that few and far between?

Hello SparkleStarlet and welcome to the KSP Forums!

We have loads of people here who love space.  You've come to the right place.

Happy landings!

Hello! We have a whole section called "Science & Spaceflight"! I would (as would everyone else on these forums) recommend KSP as both a fun game and a great tool to learn about space travel. It's physics and orbital mechanics are mostly realistic. Beware! You have entered the realm of the nerds!

19 hours ago, TheKosanianMethod said:

Hello, Sparkle! Welcome to the Forums!

Are space forums really that few and far between?

Yes indeed. I couldn't find a proper one specially in English. There was one in Italian but they only talk about astronauts and cosmonauts.. 

Thanks

19 hours ago, Starhawk said:

Hello SparkleStarlet and welcome to the KSP Forums!

We have loads of people here who love space.  You've come to the right place.

Happy landings!

Thanks. Great to hear/read that. I'm looking forward to seeing more. 

18 hours ago, KAL 9000 said:

Hello! We have a whole section called "Science & Spaceflight"! I would (as would everyone else on these forums) recommend KSP as both a fun game and a great tool to learn about space travel. It's physics and orbital mechanics are mostly realistic. Beware! You have entered the realm of the nerds!

Nice. As long as I can learn new things. 

Sorry for double posting

Edited October 26, 2016 by SparkleStarlet
To apologize
No problem, double-post happens all the time, there's no need to apologize as long as you don't hog the thread .
Hello Sparkle! I hope you will enjoy the KSP forums
